U.S. War Plan Denounced in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), in a statement  on April 17 reportedly denounced the U.S. "OPLAN 5029-05" as the most dangerous plan of war against the north which is aimed to intentionally create a war climate on the Korean Peninsula and provoke a military conflict. It called for shattering the U.S. moves for a war against the north by cooperation for national independence and for peace against war.
 The statement said the present situation evidently indicates that the U.S. outcries for the "six-party talks" and "a peaceful solution" are no more than a smokescreen for concealing its war scheme against the north and vividly shows who is to blame for the clouds of war hanging over the Korean Peninsula.    
 Still today the U.S. continues shipping lethal weapons into this land and working overtime to intentionally create the ignition point of a war against the north, shouting itself hoarse over fictitious "fast changing situation," noted the statement.

Musan-Nanping Border Bridge Completed 
    Chongjin, April 20 (KCNA) -- The Musan-Nanping Bridge that links Musan County, North Hamgyong Province of Korea, to Helong City, Jilin Province of China, has been completed.
 The building of the bridge which will add shine to the history of DPRK-China friendship will help toward boosting friendship between the two peoples.    
 Participating in the ceremony for the completion of the bridge held on April 19 were officials concerned, working people in Musan County, builders and Chinese guests including the mayor of the Helong City People's Government.

Congratulations to Jordanian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Farouk Kasrawi on his appointment as foreign minister of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan.
 Expressing the belief that the ties of exchange and cooperation between the two countries and foreign ministries will grow stronger, the message wished him success in his new job.

Congratulations to Jordanian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Adnan Badran on his appointment as prime minister of the Cabinet and minister of Defence of Jordan.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished him success in his responsible work.
